summary: Couscous is a popular North African food made from tiny steamed balls of semolina. It's often served with a stew on top. Other regions use similar cooking methods with different grains, like millet or sorghum. Couscous is a staple in countries like Algeria, Tunisia, and Morocco. It became part of French and European cooking in the 1900s. In 2020, UNESCO recognized couscous as an important cultural heritage.
title: Couscous
